faculties_accepted: Please refer to the Schools & Departments at Fudan University for details: https://www.fudan.edu.cn/en/SchoolswDepartments/list.psp
module_restrictions: MBA courses and some special programs in faculties (eg Language School) are not available to Exchange and Study Abroad students.
visa_info: Exchange students in China are required to apply for student visa (X2 visa for those intending to study in China for a period of no more than 180 days and X1 visa for those intending to study in China for a period of more than 180 days).

accommodations_info.University Accommodation: Exchange students are housed at the International Students Dormitory located northwest of the Fudan campus. There are single and double rooms available. On-campus accommodation is very limited and on first come first served policy. Students who are staying for an entire academic year are eligible for accommodation on campus during semester breaks. Accommodation fees will be pro-rated. Reminder to check on the booking period at the following website and apply for accommodation early: https://ogp.fudan.edu.cn/16089/list.htm; https://iso.fudan.edu.cn/isoenglish/16212/list.htm
accommodations_info.Private Accommodation: If on-campus accommodation is not available, students may try the following resources as soon as possible: Tonghe International Student village and Hanting Hotels and Inns. For more information, please refer to http://www.fao.fudan.edu.cn/32/d7/c16089a13015/page.htm

cost_of_living.range: ranging from S$5,000 to S$15,000 per semester, subject to the country and local conditions at the overseas Partner University during the period of exchange

university_description: Fudan University is one of China's leading universities, located in the heart of Shanghai. Its academic programs cover a broad range of disciplines and it is home to a highly diverse student body from around the world.
university_address: 220 Handan Road, Yangpu District, Shanghai, China
location_cost_of_living: Cost of living in Shanghai is relatively high compared to other cities in China.
location_weather: Shanghai enjoys a subtropical climate with distinct seasons - summers are hot and humid while winters can be chilly.
location_description: Shanghai is one of China's most modern and happening cities, and is a hub for international business and trade.
location_crime: Crime in Shanghai is generally low, but as with any large city, petty theft and scams can occur.
location_transportation: Shanghai has an extensive public transportation system, including buses, trains, the metro, and taxis.
location_halal: Halal food options are available in certain areas of Shanghai, particularly in Muslim neighborhoods.
location_vegetarian: Vegetarian food options are available in Shanghai.
